r25561 | hornik | 2003-08-02 12:05:53 -0400 (Sat, 02 Aug 2003) | 6 lines

Expand use of command line option '--install': apart from 'yes' and 'no',
useful values are 'fake' for which a fake installation is performed (Unix
only for the time being) and all tests which require to run code from the
package are excluded, and 'skip' for which installation is skipped (which
is useful e.g. when testing the recommended packages).

   M /branches/R-1-7-patches/src/library/methods/R/RClassUtils.R
   M /branches/R-1-7-patches/src/library/methods/R/RMethodUtils.R
   M /branches/R-1-7-patches/src/library/methods/R/SClasses.R
   M /branches/R-1-7-patches/src/library/methods/R/oldGet.R
   M /branches/R-1-7-patches/src/library/methods/man/NextMethod.Rd
   M /branches/R-1-7-patches/src/library/methods/src/methods_list_dispatch.c


Bugs in methods for "[":
 - signatures failed to get names right if "drop" was included.
 - wrong to use match.call in this case because primitive [ code ignores arg. names
Fixed related potential bug in .MakeSignature if function had "..." as argument.

Method selection fixed to be (more nearly?) bullet-proof against
unwanted recursion when selecting a method on a function used in
method selection.  (Name spaces will eventually fix this).  Also,
related fixes should speed up method selection.

Some special-case problems in prototype() and initialize(),
esp. for supplying the .Data part (or not) in prototype.

r24313 | duncan | 2003-05-14 17:41:04 -0400 (Wed, 14 May 2003) | 2 lines
Changed paths:
   M /trunk/src/main/eval.c

In a call such as a$b$c, if there were any S4 methods defined for a$b, this would cause a$b to be evaluated twice. Set the first argument in the subsequent method dispatch to be an evaluated promise.

uncaught or left until class completion time.  The objects returned by
prototoype() are now detected and used in making the prototype of the
class.  Further bugs fixed in dealing with both contains and setIs
versions of inter-class relations.

New internal function .getNamespaceS3methodNames().
For installed packages, use packageHasNamespace() when testing for
namespaces (so that also the alternative non-NAMESPACE specification
is supported).

a \usage entry, and \usage entries for functions 'missing from the code'
(including S3 methods registered but not exported for namespaces) as
attributes of the return value, and no longer print this information
during computations.
